H0.text: Who designed the Volkswagen Beetle. Henry Ford

H1.text: Who designed the Volkswagen Beetle. Ettore Bugatti

H2.text: Who designed the Volkswagen Beetle. Enzo Ferrari

H3.text: Who designed the Volkswagen Beetle. Ferdinand Porsche

A4.text: German engineer Ferdinand Porsche and his design team began developing and designing the car in the early 1930s

A5.text: the fundamental design concept can be attributed to Béla Barényi in 1925, predating Porsche's claims by almost ten years

A6.text: Porsche received a contract from Hitler to design a people's car (or 'Volkswagen'), following on from his previous designs such as the 1931 Type 12 car designed for Zündapp.

A7.text: Porsche was later contracted by Volkswagen for additional consulting work and received a royalty on every Volkswagen Beetle manufactured.
